website_summaries.verdict: Elegant and simple, a much loved classic radio with old-fashioned slide-rule tuning.
pros: Top-rated, retro radio for quality sound
Has great speaker volume for a tabletop radio
Sleek wooden cabinet for a softer, less electronic look for the home
Aux port in back for device input
Easy to use, especially the tuning
cons: Bass is too heavy for some users
Broke for a few consumers after only a year of use

customer_reviews.title: When first turning on the radio it works fine, then after about an hour it turns to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this radio for 1 year now and have used it very little and it is already crapping out! Doesn't stay on the station for very long without static feedback. When first turning on the radio it works fine, then after about an hour it turns to static. I have to turn it off and turn it back and everything is fine for awhile. Amazon won't do anything because the warranty expired after 30 days. This is supposed to be a good radio. I will be very careful of what I purchase from Amazon and check the warranty carefully.
customer_reviews.author: Jill D. Preston

customer_reviews.title: worked great November 2016 but by June 2017 the lights are ...
customer_reviews.text: worked great November 2016 but by June 2017 the lights are on but no sound comes out unless you turn it all the way up and hold it close to your ear. It used to blast sound and the sound was great so it went from a 10 to a 1. i used it this morning and now this evening it has stopped. I see other people had this problem. I hope its a 1 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: jack hazard

customer_reviews.title: No AM reception
customer_reviews.text: If you are purchasing this for AM reception think twice if it's worth it especially when no matter where you move the radio in your home and no matter how many which ways from Tuesday's you turn the dial it doesn't come in😣
customer_reviews.author: K. szewczuk

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: This radio stopped working today. Not even a year old and the volume and selector switch has gone bad. I have volume when I first turn it on then the volume fades to where it is to quiet to be heard almost immediately. the external FM and AM ports never did seem to improve reception. Heart broken. I really wanted to like this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Monroe Family

customer_reviews.title: Indoor FM reception is great. Needed help with indoor AM reception.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio to listen to AM radio indoors. With the internal AM antenna alone the reception was very poor. I added the Eaton CORP NGAN200 indoor loop am antenna, and the reception greatly improved. I'm very happy with the set up. For the price it's a good deal. I own several radios and the only one that I got ever great indoor AM reception out of the box is the Grundig SATILLITA 750, but it costs over $300.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Hirzel

customer_reviews.title: another unfortunate Sangean disappointment
customer_reviews.text: worked fantastically for months and looked great, then suddenly no matter what station it was tuned to the radio would break into a very loud buzzing noise, then it would tune back in, it began by doing this every few minutes, then it every few seconds. it was a complete waste of a significant sum of money
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my beloved Bose awr1-1w that had all controls on the unit. Sadly, it got wet from being under a hanging plant. Completely killed the radio even after months drying out. I would happily buy a new one with the same options as I lost the remote. Newer Bose only control from a remote only. Total b.s. This Sangean sounds the same to me. Perfect compact size and deep bass. I love it! I would recommend it to anyone skeptical about the sound quality. You will hear for yourself. P.s., I do have another Bose without unit control and miss the option of being able to control off the unit.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: All of a sudden no sound on all 3 of these I have
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought this radio was amazing. I bought a total of 3. Now all 3 all of a sudden have spurts where they won't work unless you hit the top of the radio. It's like when you saw a joke on tv when someone would hit the top of a tv to get it to work. I am so upset b/c now I'm stuck with 3 $78 radios that are not working correctly. Big coincidence that all 3 are doing the same thing. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PerryHallKim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound
customer_reviews.text: Worth the purchase. Great rich sound quality. Excellent quality item. Outstanding radio reception. Have been using now for a week. Really awesome product. Clear as a bell.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my Grandma because her portable radio gave up on her finally and she needed a new one. I haven’t used a radio let alone one like this since I was a teenager in the 90’s before everything started going digital. This radio sounds great and looks good in her apartment now I wanna get another for myself but I don’t need it but if I did I definitely would buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Sound is just Ok
customer_reviews.text: The sound is pretty good, but has muddy bass that is too heavy. From what I understand the Tivoli isn't a whole lot better. Does anyone know of a good sounding radio? Looks great and well constructed. By the way, this radio picks up signals as good as any other, but the sound will almost always be improved with an external antenna unless you live next to the radio station. Go ahead and order an external antenna  from amazon. It is inexpensive and works well with this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: oh what a darling
customer_reviews.text: I got an xm radio that i had for years and good but it keeps costing more each year so i unplug that. I got a stereo that sucks. With digital, it won't pick up the stations that u looking for so i ditch that i got here this radio. Just what i'm looking for. has a jack to connect an antenna which i like. SO it works great and the nobs have that classic look and feel to them SO i give this a #1. just have to find a good antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this radio is solid. Great quality and dials feel sturdy. Looks great too, no regrets. I shut off the tv awhile ago and appreciate being able to listen to talk radio to give me some background to an otherwise quiet and empty house.
customer_reviews.author: Dubmon

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality after 2 months use
customer_reviews.text: I always type out positive reviews whenever I have the time. But this radio is no good! I purchased this for my elderly father who's not really into the tech gadgets and it's no longer working as it originally did. I purchased this radio June, 2016 just barely two months ago! When I first purchased it the sound quality was great, now we can barely hear the radio. I'm taking this to an e-waste facility. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Not for AM listening as others complain, FM good, not good for AM voice or music etc.
customer_reviews.text: This ain't no CCrane am radio for sure. FM sound quality and sensitivity excellent. AM not designed correctly as there is no tone control for the overly excessive bass to the point where unable to understand the voice talking. The AM sound is muffled and sensitivity average. This radio is meant for FM only obviously but I bought it for AM. The good thing is you can put external antennas but there is no way to correct the muffled sound for AM. For the price I expected better but if you use for AM buy any other radio.
customer_reviews.author: x6729c

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound Quality & Tuning
customer_reviews.text: This little very cute retro tuner produces amazingly rich, clear sound quality -- it sounds much more expensive than it is. Not only does it look good with almost any decor (my room is fairly Traditional and it blends in, but also looked good in another Mid-Century Modern room), but the tuning is outstanding! Radio clearly locks into available stations (which are many...more than I knew we had in our area from using a previous very high-end tuner). Whether you listen to Classical, Jazz, or rock (I listen to all three), this tuner can provide you with vibrant sound and clear signal.
customer_reviews.author: LuvsPugs

customer_reviews.title: Terrible reception for years
customer_reviews.text: We have a radio tower within 8 kms of us. The CN tower in Toronto. For those who dont know it was the tallest free standing tower for decades. From that tower the CBC or our national broadcasts for a massive area. The reception is poor fuzzy and dials off on its own. What a piece of... not good workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: GCL

customer_reviews.title: Next to zero AM reception
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older iHome radio in the kitchen as the other one was styled for an iPod no longer in use. Sadly the new radio had next to no AM reception. I had the two units plugged in side by side and tried tuning into my wife's favorite news station. The iHome was OK but the Sangean was very fuzzy and not at all clear, I unplugged the iHome to make sure it wasn't somehow interfering, no difference. I did not try any FM stations on the Sangean as I was only interested in the AM reception. Sadly it has to go back as it's just not suitable.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Cotter

customer_reviews.title: A good sounding little radio
customer_reviews.text: It's everything I was expecting, a good sounding AM-FM radio with a lot of bass for its size. When buying it, recommendations for an add on antenna popped up, but I thought I'd see how it does on its own and it's just fine. I live in a small city in the upper midwest and a lot of stations come in clear as a bell. If you like to jump around to various stations this may not be the best choice for you, there are no presets, but I knew that going in. It has two lines out and a line in if you need them. Old school simplicity and fine quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tubescreamer

customer_reviews.title: Lousy, a real pain!!!
customer_reviews.text: Jumps stations frequently. Skips stations my ancient radios get. Even when it stays on a station it jerks volume, like 50%.
customer_reviews.author: Operafilly

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic radio
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a radio I'd been using for over 30 years - a small "boom-box" type of cassette player and radio. I decided I wanted something decent, and I didn't want to pay premium prices. I settled on this, and I'm really glad I did. The sound quality is fantastic, and sounds were coming out of the broadcast that I never knew were there. Yes, it's a bit more than most of us generally consider paying for a radio, but I suspect almost anyone would be pleased with their purchase if they got this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Sound doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I shop early for the holidays and purchased this as a gift. When opened last week the recipient discovered the volume doesn't work. It's very low. Impossible to hear. Heartbreaking as it appears too late to return and a big cost item for me. I bought it as I personally own one that is phenomenal. I hope the company might please allow an exchange?
customer_reviews.author: Natashamay

customer_reviews.title: An Okay Radio For The Money,  if You Like FM Only
customer_reviews.text: Two negatives. First, on AM the radio is picking up interference from nearby computers on my desk. I am not sure if it is the fault of the computers or if the radio does not have the proper interference filtering. Secondly, it does not seem to improve AM signal strength when I connect an external, long wire AM antenna. This is a very troubling characteristic. The FM reception improves with an external antenna and the audio quality on FM is good.
customer_reviews.author: USA-Vet

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and reception
customer_reviews.text: Love this radio! I asked for this for Mother's day and got it! We live in a remote area between mountains with very bad reception. Internet is sketchy at best and have a booster for cell phone that helps if the wind is blowing the right way. Plugged this radio in and got great reception without external antenna. Some say it's got a lot of base. To me it sounds like what a stereo system sounded like back before digital ruined everything. Very deep smooth sound! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Bernie

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: After less than a year of use the radio stopped working. The radio would start to play then the sound would fade out. Sometimes we could get the sound back and sometimes not. After 2 years it seems that it has stopped functioning all together. It looks great but does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Mama H

customer_reviews.title: Quite Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Arrived so quickly W/ free shipping. Sound is great. I am no techie so I can only speak to the basics. Great base, clear reception on many stations and very user friendly. We live out East on L.I., N.Y. and getting in stations is a real issue. Glad I choose this radio over the Bose wave. The reviews said dollar for dollar it can't be beat. Right by me. Love the look of the radio and happy to be able to just turn it on without a degree in electronics.
customer_reviews.author: HHM

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with reception 😟
customer_reviews.text: Bought the extra antenna and still unable to get FM stations...even my local network.
customer_reviews.author: Peace

customer_reviews.title: Pulls in Distant Stations Clearly
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a wood cabinet table radio for the living room that also pulls in hard to reach stations: the Sangean works beautifully for us to meet our needs. We love classical music, and this radio pulls in a station from 60 miles away that we enjoy, The sound and tone are excellent, with easy adjustments: we live in a smaller city with a not-very-sophisticated classical station. So now we can listen to the "big city" station with pleasure and no static or interference of another station "bleeding" into the one desire.
customer_reviews.author: Austen reader 1775

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Wanted just a basic table radio and this is it. I have other battery powered models from this manufacturer and they are well made. This model has a really nice wood finish and looks good sitting on the counter. My wife was skeptical of having a radio sitting on her kitchen counter but she loves the looks. Great sound for a single speaker. Some don't like the analog tuning but I like the old school look and feel. Excellent radio for the price
customer_reviews.author: Banditrider

customer_reviews.title: AM reception is very disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio due to raving reviews & its brand name. I thought I bought a quality item that would be enjoyed for a long time. Unfortunately it was more than a disappointment. I mostly listen to AM channels and this radio AM reception is worse than a cheap radio. Not only that, but the sound also comes out muffled, not clear at all. It was so bad that I returned it today. It also was a lot heavier than expected, not very portable. There was no packing done ---they just shipped it by itself so the box got beaten up. I don't recommend it at all.
customer_reviews.author: L. Keel

customer_reviews.title: Sounds as good as it looks.
customer_reviews.text: This is a digitally tuned radio with analog controls. Tuning it takes a little getting used to, but seems as sensitive as anything else in the house. I can get most of the local stations with nothing else connected to it, and the AM reception is respectable by modern standards. FM is clean and the sound is pretty balanced for something of this size. It's not overly boomy, but has meaningful bass response and clean highs. It does depend on what your listening to. Pop music might be overly bright, and urban sounds a little boxy. Talk sounds smooth and natural. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: ninjarider

customer_reviews.title: Terrific little radio
customer_reviews.text: Finally a radio that sounds great. Easy to use. No fancy techie nonsense. Just perfect...love it.
customer_reviews.author: David Gluck

customer_reviews.title: NO AUDIO on my Sangean WR-11SE AM/FM 40th anniversary radio ordered Feb 2, 2019!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sangean WR-11SE AM/FM table top 40th Anniversary radio on Feb 2, 2019. The radio worked for awhile then the audio disappeared! If I turn the radio on & off (rather quickly) the audio would ‘click on’ then a few days later NO AUDIO! Help, I’m sick of this radio! Would I recommend ! according to what I’m experiencing NO, I do not recommend this radio!
customer_reviews.author: PGTAZ

customer_reviews.title: Just a great radio.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for a tabletop radio. Excellent fine-tuning knob. Cool dial lighting. The best thing of all: it's just a radio. No fancy docking nonsense; no Bluetooth. Thank God. The only low-point: the non-40th Anniversary model's faceplate/knobs are plastic, rather than metal. This isn't a huge issue, especially with the black version. But the cream colored version (which I had mistaken for a lightly burnished (?) silver color via the picture) looks cheap and sort of sickly--an odd color choice, in my opinion, for an otherwise classy-looking set-up. That one is in the garage. Highly recommended, otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Scoop

customer_reviews.title: Disposable radio: use for a year and discard!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio about 18 months ago and it seemed fine for the first year. But unlike the radio that it replaced, a cheaper radio that lasted about 10 or more years, it started to "cut out" of reception intermittently. This became more frequent with more static to the point where we are at today when it frequently goes silent or gets static frequently. That is not acceptable quality unless you like buying radios every 1-2 years. Think before you shell out $76 for this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... tunes in both local and distant AM radio stations better than any radio I have owned in over 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: This Sangen WR-11 radio tunes in both local and distant AM radio stations better than any radio I have owned in over 10 years... It works extremely well in New Franklin Missouri Zip Code 65274 USA ... at 800 feet above sea level... in the Missouri River Valley. The sound quality is much better than expected. I am very satisfied with this radio. It sounds so good that A Bose radio is no longer on my shopping list. Thank you Amazon, for bringing distant AM talk radio stations back to my Rural Missouri home.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: My sister bought this for me for my Christmas, I can't use it yet I have to wait until Christmas. She's been wanting a radio for her bedroom and I ordered this for her and she paid me back. She wanted me to open this radio and make sure it was in good shape so I did and the sound was incredible, I couldn't believe it. So she thought if its this good, maybe I would like to have one for Christmas and that's how I ended up getting one of my own. Great Radio and it doesn't take up a lot of space, sound is wonderful. I can't wait until Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: If only it could pick up the one station I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a nice little radio to enjoy classical music playing in the background. We have a station that doesn't come in great (but comes in) on my clock radio so I figured this expensive fancy radio would pick it up fine, but it actually doesn't pick it up all. Disappointed. I tried an external antenna, still nothing. Seems like my $10 clock radio has better a tuner, I don't know. For the stations that come in it really sounds great, I wish I could keep it but it won't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ian C

customer_reviews.title: Expected More Than A Year's Life.
customer_reviews.text: During my first year of ownership, I would have given this radio 5 stars. Great sound. Easy tuning. Picked up stations strongly and held them well. Sleek, attractive design. And then, the audio started cutting out about 10 minutes after the unit was turned on. The tuner worked well while the sound still played. After the sound died, the power light stayed lit. And it wasn't long before there was no sound upon startup. It did, however, manage to outlive its warranty. Harrumph.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen L. Horr

customer_reviews.title: poor tone and station holding
customer_reviews.text: Over-priced, poor tone and station holding, and does not pull in those weak stations it was supposed too. And was very expensive, for a cheap radio. Don't buy it . You'll be sorry!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Clay

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am using this radio at work and have the volume fairly low to not disturb my neighbors. Although the sound is somewhat lacking in treble it also very pleasing and those around me are very impressed when I demo it for them at louder volumes. I have also had several comments on the cool retro look. The unit is quite heavy for its size and everything about it says quality. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Product is a ZERO
customer_reviews.text: The radio will no longer pick up the stations that I listen too on a regular basis as I work from home and use this as background music. Stations will come in and then for some reason just go to static. This item is only 3 months old and now it is basically not in usable condition. I should have read the reviews before ordering as this seems to be an ongoing problem. I would suggest another manufacturer that builds better products. product was good for 2 months but spending $80 you should expect a better radio!!!! Buyer Beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Tacky Looking
customer_reviews.text: A big part of the reason I bought this radio is because I liked the look of the walnut finish, however, it does not look anything like the picture. It's a light color wood, like pine. Also the front panel has a greenish tint to it. Not a good look at all.
customer_reviews.author: Desirée

customer_reviews.title: Sangean SR-11 Tabletop Radio
customer_reviews.text: I already own the Sangean WR-2 radio and it’s always tuned to either our local classical music or NPR FM station. When I needed to replace a portable radio in another part of my home, I again looked to Sangean. I love the wooden cabinets and this time I opted for the very uncomplicated WR-11 as a simple alternative. The sound quality is very good. The dials need to be turned to turn the radio on (rather than pressing a button) and I sometimes find that knob hard to turn because the three knobs are close together. I didn’t think I would miss the digital station, volume, and time display available on the WR-2 model, but I do.
customer_reviews.author: Joan R. Luterman

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful One Piece Wooden Cabinet and Retro Styled Radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio is my second Sangean Radio, the first being a Sangean PR D5 portable that accepts batteries. I so enjoyed that radio that I fell in love with the retro look of this one. It is perfect in my small 100 year old cottage. I love the wooden cabinet which is a single solid piece of beautiful wood. It has good reception, and I have used the included FM antenna as well as my Turk Advantage AM antenna which easily wired on to the back of the radio. Both antennas worked well with this radio. I am so happy I treated myself to this!
customer_reviews.author: StephTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT. Just PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 93-year-old mother, and it is PERFECT. It has old-fashioned knobs, with a horizontal "dial" for tuning, and for turning on and off and for raising or lowering the volume, so it is PERFECT for those who are unfamiliar with "digital" gadgets. Rich sound of first-rate quality and clarity. Real wood. Light weight. Easy to move around the house. We could not be more pleased with this product. Perfect in every way. VERY reasonable price, too! HIGHLY recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Noegel

customer_reviews.title: solid radio
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find a good solid table radio.Yea I know old tech-use streaming.In the morning half asleep before the coffee is made you just want to simple turn on to listen to talk radio(sports,etc) Most of the radios are flimsy and tuners are ok at best. Nice solid feeling knobs tuner is smooth and very accurate.Booming sound both AM/FM(bass port in back).Great looking golden color and even has various input/output jacks. Small complaint is there should be a treble knob-the AM (one station has both AM and FM broadcasting but AM comes in stronger) station is "muddy". FM sound excellent. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: trLitFls

customer_reviews.title: Great sounds
customer_reviews.text: This radio was for my 88 year old mother. I wanted the old analog style instead of digital, that she would be more familiar with. The radio is easy for her to wok and sound is excellent. She just loves this radio and listens to it daily.
customer_reviews.author: !Joe Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Attractive Small Retro Radio with Rich Full Sound
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small, wired radio that would look like part of the furniture in my guest room. I love this retro design because it is minimalist (3 knobs) and easy to use. I don't have to explain how to use it to my guest. You turn it on, off, raise or lower volume, tune in a radio channel, or plug your ipod into the back. The attractive wooden case also serves to broadcast a full, balanced sound. It favors the bass, which is unusual in a small radio. It's well-made, and priced affordably. It looks so good in my guest room that I bought a second one for my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: L Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Great for the No Fuss Crowd.
customer_reviews.text: Three knobs. Beautiful Cabinet. Simple operation, Non drift reception. Fair price. Good sound quality and volume, Invest in an antenna as the one single wire one supplied may be insufficient. 95 year old Mom loves this radio. Future upgrades making this a 5 star item, which would jump the price: Digital Tuner HD capable tuner USB Connection for MP3 Player Extra Speaker & stereo capability Pipe Dream?
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: I have bought five of these radios. Three for friends.
customer_reviews.text: Second review, after six months of owning. I have since bought this as a gift for two radio "snobs." They both love it. They enjoy the FM. And very much so. The AM is not quite sharp enough for me in tone. (I like Coast to Coast). That said, I can say, that the FM sound on this radio is amazing. Rich, warm and with a punch. Whether classical, jazz or talk. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good reception in a problematic location
customer_reviews.text: Radio purchased as a gift for use in the first floor of a building on the back of a hill in relation to downtown Manhattan. Reception varies significantly within the apartment and is fair to poor in this particular location. FM reception was reasonable without an FM antenna but improved to excellent with the TERK Omni-Directional FM antenna. Since this is an analog unit, the location of the frequency pointer is a bit off, but once located, reception is very good. The radio has too much bass for my taste - something like a 1960s tuner. Very simple controls make it easy to use for someone who doesn't want complexity.
customer_reviews.author: H. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Superb Sound
customer_reviews.text: Smooth and dampened controls, quality wooden case. There is an amazing lack of sound distortion at almost any volume! An excellent choice if the quality of sound and lack of distortion are important factors. I bought the radio for my Mother, who was almost deaf. The sound quality was so good she could hear it at relatively low volumes....a relief to anyone living within a block of the house. A solid investment.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hartgrove

customer_reviews.title: Small with mostly good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I listen to AM radio whenever I am home, fan of talk radio going back to the Art Bell show. The footprint is good for a bedside table, it beats the GE super radio. After an initial time that it would drift within minutes of tuning, it doesn't drift at all. This happened after the initial power up and happened 4-5 times. The radio would benefit from bass and treble controls, its the only thing lacking. It does have substantial bass with some voices, almost too much. Currently with drift it beats the GE Super Radio. AM reception is fine, I notice nothing I can't pick up compared to other radios.
customer_reviews.author: David Velliquette

customer_reviews.title: Very, Very good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great radio. It is good looking and sounds great. It's appearance speaks of quality. The radio arrived in a sturdy, good looking box which was securely packed within a Amazon carton. It just came today so I cannot swear to the radio's longetive but it looks like a quality item so I think it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good radio -- all bass, no treble
customer_reviews.text: Tunes easily. No drift, solid tuning lock. Tuning LED works well. Nice looking. Very compact. Good, functional radio. This radio gets Minnesota Public Radio with no drift or static. Several other radios in my house have a lot of noise on MPR. This radio is quiet and stable. Mediocre sound quality. Heavy bass, almost no treble. Not sure how to explain -- this radio makes my ears tired. Where is the crispness, the higher tones, the character?
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kauper

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the WR-11 for about five weeks now, and I absolutely love it. I use it almost every day, and I've experienced zero issues. When I first turned it on, I couldn't believe how warm, clear, and powerful the sound was for such a small radio. I'd totally recommend it, and I'm excited to try out some other Sangean products. I really want the larger WR-12!
customer_reviews.author: Justin K.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift to my mother for her Birthday. She loves it. I think she loves the design and nostalgia that is exudes as well. She listens to it all the time. Great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Nellie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio is an audiophiles dream. High quality sound, reception, and dials. Perfect for those not savvy with the digital age with all the gadgets/apps. This is my second Sangean radio and I have a brand I'll stick with. My first one has digital programming that I love, but not my girlfriend. Shipping on time and carefully packed.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Just a good all around sturdy  FM radio- and good looking
customer_reviews.text: Just use it for FM and for that it's clear and easy on your ears. I'm including this for those who want a better idea of the looks of the thing as the pics don't really get the colors right and some want to know. The case is a medium light wood color, the front metal etc. is a soft golden color and the "on button" and "station buttons" are a good lively green.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great design and quality except for muddy bass at loud volumes
customer_reviews.text: This radio was just what I was looking for as a night table radio. The design and quality are evident just as soon as you begin to use it. While we play this at low volume, the other reviews that mention muddy bass at mid and high volumes are correct. It is not meant to fill a room with loud music but is O.K. with low to mid volume music. The tuner portion on this is great and we get more stations than we did with our previous radio and they stay locked in. All in all, a pretty good little radio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and I love that it's covered in real wood. The plastic front panel looks nice too - it doesn't look cheap. This is perfect if you want a nice, wood-exterior radio that look's sturdy and dignified (not cheap and plastic). The aux cable part works well, too, although I do wish it had a three-way knob like other models so you don't have to unplug the cable every time you want to switch back to FM. You'll probably need to turn up your iphone all the way though to get equivalent volume to radio, since this won't amplify the aux input as much as the radio signal.
customer_reviews.author: Amalfitano

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Piece!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to replace an old radio, which did not have good sound quality. This radio did not disappoint! The case is real wood and simple and sleek. The sound is great and the controls are simple and straightforward. I’m probably going to buy another for my vacation home. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Pear Tree

customer_reviews.title: Sangean better than Tivoli
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Sangean to replace a Tivoli Model One. The Sangean WR-11SE is superb to Tivoli in every way, especially tuning knob. Tivoli would need knob turned in microscopic increments, and if you're lucky you'd get the station you were searching for. Eventually wouldn't even stay on some radio stations tuned to. Sangean sound is at least 2 extra stars better, the wood cabinet is sturdier/better looking, and the tuning dial is silky and stays exactly on station. The receiving hardware/software pulls in radio stations clearer - by two stars more. Bottom line: Tivoli was average (3.0), at best; Sangean is a 4.7 out of 5.0, at least.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This radio is exactly what I need. I love listening to the radio but dislike the tone/sound of a Bluetooth speaker. I don’t want a CD/radio combo. Streaming my favorite radio station is not the same as tuning in on the radio. This radio has excellent tone, sound, volume AND can be used to stream from online sources with a wired connection. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Sangean WR-11SE AM/FM Table Top Radio 40th Anniversary Edition
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a high quality radio for my wife's home office and this one is PERFECT in every way. The construction is heavy duty and solid and the sound quality is phenominal. I purchased an extra long antenna as her former cd\stereo was hard to tune in too a station w/out a little static but this Sangean worked right out of the box w/no extra antenna needed. This unit is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Great tabletop radio for the money. Full nice sound. Yes, there is a surprising amount of bass for this little radio, but it is not too much for me with classical and Christian hymns on FM. AM is decent, but I prefer using a portal for AM. However, for a monaural radio, you can not expect it to have the detail of a decent stereo system. For this reasonable price, you get a good quality tabletop radio made with quality materials and looks great on bookshelf
customer_reviews.author: iGreg

customer_reviews.title: Great radio
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I got this radio for my law office. I moved from a "regular" office building that had pa music,, to a silent building. This was way better than the old pa. The sound quality is better than any of my Google home speakers, which is weird because they advertise loudly about their sound quality. I got one of these radios for my living room and also for my wife's classroom. Just spectacular for the price. Just get it, fantastic value.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This Sangean analog radio sounds great. This was purchased for my mother-in-law (89 years old) and she loves the easy use of the traditional analog knobs. We got her a high end digital radio with CD player and remote, which was too confusing. I know another brand that makes this (starts with a "T" and ends with an "i"). That brand's knobs for adjusting is too finicky and sensitive. The Sangean is has heavy wood casing, wonderful color, adjusts stations easily with no static, and balanced, rich sound.
customer_reviews.author: VirgoSuite71

customer_reviews.title: This is a great radio. I use it primarily with a Google ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great radio. I use it primarily with a Google Chromecast Audio dongle to stream music from my phone. Speaker is fairly balanced, roll off on the high end and good low end - i.e,. it's 'warm', but not hyper low boomy garbage that is very prevalent now. I liked it so much that I bought a second one 2 days after the first arrived along with another CCA. I now have multi-room music from a great sounding (and looking) radio. Couldn't be happier with this.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Quality, elegant, easy.
customer_reviews.text: We're a family of.radiio llsteners. I sent thiis to my daughter who is delighted with the quality and performance of this beautiful radio. She reports it's easy to tune, stays clear, sounds rich, and looks classy. Understated elegance with excellent design describes her response. Make someone happy. This radio is a fine gift that your recipient can appreciate for many years.
customer_reviews.author: bevWr

customer_reviews.title: Just a good, simple radio
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a month now, listening to various music types in my bedroom. Overall this feels like a well made radio, the sound quality is good and plenty loud enough for my needs. I do reccomend buying the extendable antenna to attach to the back for better reception. The three dials on the front are straightforward to use and the extra ports on the back for aux, headphones, and so on are a definite plus. One thing that prevents me from giving it five stars is that the tuner does not accurately show the station it's on, for example, turning the dial to station 96.5 would actually play 95.5. Otherwise it's just a good simple radio.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but have to adjust frequently adjust station
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful sound - it is always on NPR but I have to frequently adjust the station in the morning to get the best reception - we have this on top of a kitchen cabinet and I can reach it as I am 6'3" but my wife has to stand on a chair so it is inconvenient for her- once the station is tuned in it works fine - I suspect it is due to temperature changes in our kitchen as we turn the heat down every night
customer_reviews.author: Bob Haydock

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio, best value
customer_reviews.text: I own this and a Tivoli Model One. They are almost identical in operation. The Sangean has a little more bass in the sound. The Sangean is absolutely beautiful. It costs half what the Tivoli does and gives up nothing in sound or quality. I would suggest this radio over the Tivoli, its every bit as good at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Small radio...big sound
customer_reviews.text: Love my new radio. Tried another (Sony) and it couldn't get but local stations. This little radio pulls in the NPR station I wanted with amazing clarity and sound. I also purchased the extra FM antenna for 'filtering'...but didn't even need it. The bonus is she's a pretty little thing as well.
customer_reviews.author: MOUNTAIN LADY

customer_reviews.title: My mother can hear music again!
customer_reviews.text: My 82 year old mother wears hearing aids and has not enjoyed listening to music in a couple decades. Her old stereo finally quit and I bought her this radio based on the reviews. She is ecstatic over it. The sound is so clear that she can hear and appreciate music again. She says that other stereos and radios do not filter music well and it just sounds like noise to someone with hearing aids. This radio has absolutely notched up her quality of life. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool Item
customer_reviews.text: My radio arrived today and I'm very pleased with it. I live in a building where radio reception isn't the best but this is pulling in all the local AM and FM stations crystal clear. It looks, feels and sounds like something from the 1970s, which for me, is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great radio
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound from this little gem Nice bass Sounds like a larger radio Added an auxiliary antenna ,get great reception
customer_reviews.author: Brent Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: EZ PZ On and Off!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, straightforward radio with nice lines, pretty wood cabinet, really nice sound. Bought this for a relative with some cognitive difficulties and an aversion to electronic devices. It is easy to operate and brings lots of joy to the new owner.
customer_reviews.author: jgr2

customer_reviews.title: Great product with one dissapointment
customer_reviews.text: Love this radio. Quality item with a classic look. Taking of one star off however because I ordered the WR-11SE model specifically liking the darker color of the wood. Upon opening out of the box to my dissapointment it was the other model with the lighter colored wood. The box and back of the unit however said WR-11SE. It appears that the wrong color wood was put on my unit. Not sure if this was an honest mistake or they were out of the darker color because when I placed my order the light wood model was available immediately but the dark wood model had a 2 to 3 week wait however I received mine much earlier than that.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: This radio is beautiful. I kind of wanted something that I had ...
customer_reviews.text: This radio is beautiful. I kind of wanted something that I had when I was younger. There is no digital involved. You must tune to the stations. Feedback is awesome. The sound is deep and crisp. I'm looking into buying the taller one. In any event, you cannot go wrong with this one if you are looking for sound from days of old (I know, sounds like I'm old, right?) ...I'm not old (don't think so anyway) ... Well worth the $$$ !!!
customer_reviews.author: Patty R.

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good, Sounds Good !
customer_reviews.text: This is a superior radio. It's a no nonsense radio providing great clear sound. Others have been critical of the base but I find it compatible with high fidelity radios ratio of base to volume. Perhaps if the base is overwhelming, try to put the radio in the open without a solid object behind it. This surely is a sweet radio.
customer_reviews.author: Wynn

customer_reviews.title: I'm really pleased with this radio
customer_reviews.text: I'm really pleased with this radio. Reception is excellent where other radios have been useless. I intentionally bought a mono radio to avoid the irritating on-and-off hiss that seems to be endemic to FM stereo in this "fringe" area, but was surprised by clean stereo reception while using headphones as well. My only gripe is that the "dynamic bass compensation" used to get the most out of the small built-in speaker seems to boost the low mids excessively when using quality headphones (Grados). But that really isn't it's purpose. I needed a presentable, simple tabletop radio with excellent reception and decent sound, and I found it. Best I ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskan Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Fine for pulling in weak stations
customer_reviews.text: In my shop, I can't get any but the strongest stations. Of course, the ones I want to listen to are barely able to come in. This radio with the dipole antenna picks up weak stations like gangbusters. I can even listen to Gangbusters if I want to. This radio does not have stereo high-fidelity sound but it's not designed to. But it sounds good enough for my shop and pulls in weak stations very well.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Richrod

customer_reviews.title: It looks good and was easy to set up. Simple controls.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this radio. I bought it for my mother who is 80. She listens to talk radio. I wanted a radio that would be stylish and simple. It is very clean looking and only has 3 knobs (controls). I can't give it 5 stars, because the reception is not great and I even added an antenna I purchase here at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Army Navy Guns

customer_reviews.title: It's so beautifully made. I love the beauty and simplicity or ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this twice, once for our Florida beach house and another for our home. It's so beautifully made. I love the beauty and simplicity or it. We have had i phone controlled in ceiling speakers and wireless bluetooth speakers etc. and honestly I found it all just exhausting. This is so easy and simple and just works and looks fantastic. Initially I didn't like the pale gold front but now I absolutely love the warmth of it. Thinking of getting another for my 74 year old father for father's day. It's the perfect gift for "not too technical" parents!
customer_reviews.author: J.S

customer_reviews.title: A great buy--and as good as my Tivoli One
customer_reviews.text: The Sangean WR-11 is a beautiful radio and has a wonderful sound quality to it, my only quibble is slightly too much bass. I brought a Tivoli One when they first came out and were reasonably priced ($99). I have enjoyed my Tivoli but in a side-by-side comparison listening to a classical FM station the difference was not noticeable, although the One could get slightly louder. They had very similar sensitivity to distant stations also. The Sangean has a little less "buzzing" on the AM (MW) band. Based on my experience, I would recommend saving a great deal of money and choosing the Sangean--but that is only the opinion of one set of 63 year old ears.
customer_reviews.author: Vermonter

customer_reviews.title: I Like It!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the radio to access AM radio stations. The radio reception is good in it's current location. This radio is heavier than most radios its size. All of the dials are sturdy and operate smoothly. Fit and finish appears to be good. Overall, the unit functions as it should. I'm happy with this purchase. MRC
customer_reviews.author: Michael Crice

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Radio
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound quality, actually pretty good for a small table radio. Cabinet is attractive. On the whole I am well satisfied, in fact this is the second one I have purchased. The first one has a cream color grill and face plate which I think is more attractive than the "gold" color on the first one I bought, but that is not a biggie.
customer_reviews.author: old dude

customer_reviews.title: sound quality is bassy
customer_reviews.text: The radio is a good product, but the sound is terrible. It sounds like a pillow is on top. There is no high frequency at all and talk radio consists of vowels only mumbling. That written, it is good for rock n roll though.
customer_reviews.author: tangomikesierra

customer_reviews.title: Great For Weak Reception
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad that my wife is very happy with this radio. It's able to pick up a low powered FM station miles away while using the included external antenna. Had to play with the location of the antenna to find the "sweet spot" but after I did it pulls in the station like a champ. We have other radios but none of them can get that FM station.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thane

customer_reviews.title: Great radio that's also beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This radio has a beautiful design that's evocative of midcentury modern. It's small so it fits anywhere and the sound is wonderful. I got it based on a review in the New York Times and it does not disappoint. I'm thrilled with this radio.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 89 year old mother. She says it looks nice and was easy to set up. It's really a basic radio. There are no apps or pairing or other high tech barriers for an older person. I haven't heard it play so I can't speak to the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: RateThis

customer_reviews.title: Simple but superior.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a simple but quality radio that goes on and off from a switched plug in our barn. Digitally synthesized radios almost always don't come back on once AC power is switched back on, so today's choices are slim if you also want pleasant and robust audio. This analog Sangean model fills the bill nicely, although we'll have to wait until this winter to see whether its analog tuning capacitor results in temperature-related tuning drift. Audio is similar to that of its pricier WR-2 digital sibling, as well as the digital Tivoli Model One. FM sensitivity to weak signals is superior, as well, even using just the dinky little wire antenna that comes with the WR-11.
customer_reviews.author: radyo

customer_reviews.title: Great radio
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio, it has an old school look and great quality. The only problem I had was with the wire like antenna got caught in the vacuum and snatched off the radio, but that was my fault. Highly recommend and would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Russell

customer_reviews.title: One fine Radio!
customer_reviews.text: They still build them like they used to. After four years and 18,000+ hours, my Tivoli Model 1 packed it in, with the usual complaint, a $2 tuning capacitor in $150 radio. These Sangean WR-11s have a well deserved reputation for being better than the Tivoli in every way, and the reviews aren't wrong. It's one fine radio, and I'm looking forward to years of enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: SNB

customer_reviews.title: Very good selectivity and appearance, bassy sound
customer_reviews.text: The WR-11 is serving as my kitchen radio. It's in a rural area with quirky signal strengths. The radio gets very good and clear reception of AM and FM stations that are subject to interference from other stations with nearby frequencies. It receives distant signals quite well using only the single wire external antenna. Yes, the sound is somewhat bass heavy but like other reviewers I find I'm getting accustomed to that quickly and don't mind it.
customer_reviews.author: MK Gee

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: this was a gift for my 87 yr old mother in law who has difficulty with digital radios. She loved that she could use the dials for tuning. We had the radio on Christmas Eve listening to Christmas music and the sound/volume was crisp, clear and concise. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my elderly grandmother
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio for my elderly grandmother. She wanted an "old school" and simpler type of radio. It has a beautiful wood finish and really looks nice. It has enough jacks in the rear of the radio to plug in other audio devices. The design is very clean and the sound is great.
customer_reviews.author: Parker O

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality set
customer_reviews.text: So many detailed and knowledgable reviews for this. Mine is simple. I love it. Materials made me feel I bought something high quality. I enjoy the sound. My wife came in and thought I bought an antique radio. Might buy another w the bluetooth feature for her.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas P. Frantz

product_meta.title: Sangean WR-11SE AM/FM Table Top Radio 40th Anniversary Edition
product_meta.description: Style:WR-11SE| Pattern Name:RadioSangean(TM)'s 40th Anniversary Edition Hi-Fi Tabletop Radio is a radio with vintage styling. An analog AM/FM tuner allows fine control of which station you want to listen to, and the high-quality 7W speaker with 3'' full-range driver gives you the sound that you want.
feature_bullets: Solid MDF Cabinet with a Real Walnut Veneer Finish, Soft and Precise Rotary Vernier Tuning and Volume Control
Auxiliary Input for Additional Audio Sources Like MP3 Player or iPod/iPhone
Rear Connections Include AC-In, DC-In, Aux-In, REC Out, Headphone and FM F Type Antenna Terminal
3 Inch 6.5 Watt Full Range Speaker with Enlarged Magnet and Deep Bass Compensation In a Acoustically Tuned Cabinet for Improved Sound Quality

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,154 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
